articles.title: Anthropic refuses Pentagon’s new terms, standing firm on lethal autonomous weapons and mass surveillance

articles.title: Anthropic CEO stands firm as Pentagon deadline looms
articles.titleZh: Anthropic CEO stands firm as Pentagon deadline looms
articles.summary: Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei said Thursday that he "cannot in good conscience accede" to the Pentagon's demands to give the military unrestricted access to its AI systems.

articles.title: 8 billion tokens a day forced AT&T to rethink AI orchestration — and cut costs by 90%
articles.titleZh: 8 billion tokens a day forced AT&T to rethink AI orchestration — and cut costs by 90%
articles.summary:
When your average daily token usage is 8 billion a day, you have a massive scale problem. 

This was the case at AT&T, and chief data officer Andy Markus and his team recognized that it simply wasn’t feasible (or economical) to push everything through large reasoning models.

articles.title: Claude didn't just plan an attack on Mexico's government. It executed one for a month — across four domains your security stack can't see.
articles.titleZh: Claude didn't just plan an attack on Mexico's government. It executed one for a month — across four domains your security stack can't see.

articles.title: Perplexity launches 'Computer' AI agent that coordinates 19 models, priced at $200 a month
articles.titleZh: Perplexity launches 'Computer' AI agent that coordinates 19 models, priced at $200 a month
articles.summary: Perplexity, the AI-powered search company valued at $20 billion, on Wednesday launched what it calls the most ambitious product in its three-year history: a multi-model agent orchestration platform called Computer that coordinates 19 different AI models to complete complex, long-running workflows en
